author: IGN
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
Tencent has fired back at Sony in the ongoing lawsuit over Tencent's Light of Motiram video game. Sony is alleging Motiram is a 'clone' of Horizon Zero Dawn; now Tencent is saying Sony has copied other games when Horizon was being developed, citing Ninja Theory's Enslaved: Oddsey to the West as an example. In other news, former IGN staffer Destin Legarie was sent what he believes to be legitimate leaks of the price for the upcoming ROG Xbox Ally X, and it's not going to be cheap. And finally, Borderlands 4's latest patch hopefully fixes some of the performance issues plaguing the PC version of the game.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Tencent Defends Horizon Clone, Claiming Sony Copied Ninja Theory First - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
In this snippet from Podcast Beyond 912, When people talk about difficult games, FromSoftware and Hidetaka Miyazaki’s punishing Dark Souls games are some of the first brought up, but compared to the likes of QWOP and Getting Over It With Bennett Foddy, they’re a walk in the park. We had the chance to chat with Bennett’s newest project, Baby Steps, which is quite literally a walk in the park, but unlike most games people would describe as a “walking simulator” it’s sure to be quite an uphill battle. We discuss some of the challenges, inspirations and unusual activities waiting for players in Baby Steps. 

Check out the full episode of Podcast Beyond here! - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JvQXYnThYjw

This weeks show is Max Scoville, Jada Griffin, and is produced by Nick Maillet

#IGN #Gaming
title: Yes, Baby Steps is the Dark Souls of Walking Simulators (In More Ways Than You Think) - Beyond Clips

author: IGN
description:
Dying Light: The Beast reviewed by Travis Northup on PC, also available on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S.

Dying Light: The Beast is an entertaining return to the rooftops and flesh pits I’ve come to love over the past decade. The gimmick of amping yourself up into a scary monster to fight other monsters sticks the landing and mostly makes up for a generic story and a map that has few surprises in store. However, aside from your new rampaging abilities and some freaky new boss fights, The Beast does stick pretty close to what worked in the last two games, so it may feel a bit rote to those who have played those recently. Its signature blend of parkour and melee-focused combat remains largely the same, but there’s certainly nothing wrong with having more Dying Light.
title: Dying Light: The Beast Review

author: IGN
description:
The Four Horsemen return along with a new generation of illusionists performing mind-melding twists, turns, surprises, and magic unlike anything ever captured on film.

Watch the new trailer for Now You See Me: Now You Don’t, an upcoming suspense movie starring Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Dave Franco, Isla Fisher, Justice Smith, Dominic Sessa, Ariana Greenblatt, with Rosamund Pike, and Morgan Freeman.

Now You See Me: Now You Don’t is produced by Alex Kurtzman, Roberto Orci, and Bobby Cohen. The screenplay is by Seth Grahame-Smith and Michael Lesslie and Paul Wernick & Rhett Reese. The story is by Eric Warren Singer. It is based on characters by Boaz Yakin & Edward Ricourt. 

Now You See Me: Now You Don’t, directed by Ruben Fleischer (Venom, Uncharted, Zombieland), opens in theaters on November 14, 2025.

#NowYouSeeMeNowYouDont #Movies #IGN
title: Now You See Me: Now You Don’t - Official Trailer #2 (2025) Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson

author: IGN
description:
Get a behind-the-scenes look at The Running Man in this latest video for the upcoming film starring Glen Powell, William H. Macy, Lee Pace, Michael Cera, Emilia Jones, Daniel Ezra, Jayme Lawson, Sean Hayes, Katy O’Brian with Colman Domingo and Josh Brolin. 

In a near-future society, The Running Man is the top-rated show on television—a deadly competition where contestants, known as Runners, must survive 30 days while being hunted by professional assassins, with every move broadcast to a bloodthirsty public and each day bringing a greater cash reward. Desperate to save his sick daughter, working-class Ben Richards (Glen Powell) is convinced by the show’s charming but ruthless producer, Dan Killian (Josh Brolin), to enter the game as a last resort. But Ben’s defiance, instincts, and grit turn him into an unexpected fan favorite—and a threat to the entire system. As ratings skyrocket, so does the danger, and Ben must outwit not just the Hunters, but a nation addicted to watching him fal
title: The Running Man - Official Behind the Action Featurette (2025) Glen Powell, Michael Cera

author: IGN
description:
What are the qualities of a good video game remake? Once upon a time, it was enough for a remake to simply update something with modern graphics. But as the games industry has evolved, so have tastes and gameplay systems, and thus remakes have changed, too. Now, a remake can offer a truly new experience to both long-term and new fans, with fresh new takes on decades-old ideas. The very best remakes are carefully observed balancing acts that find the sweet spot between faithful recreation and exciting new ideas. In some cases, that’s the game exactly as you thought you remembered it, now unshackled from old hardware limitations. In others, it's radical recreations that provide an alternate vision of the original’s core idea. 

With all that in mind, let’s explore the very best video game remakes. From Resident Evil 2 to the Final Fantasy 7 Remake series, these are the 15 strongest examples of remakes, judged not by their overall quality as games, but by how each project achieved its ne
title: The Top 15 Best Video Game Remakes

author: IGN
description:
Two galactic adventures await! Get a deep dive into Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 in this overview trailer for the upcoming remaster of the platformer games. Learn more about the adventure, planets you'll explore, Mario's abilities, power-ups, Yoshi's abilities, Assist Mode, Soundtrack Modes, a new chapter coming to the Storybook in Super Mario Galaxy, and a new Storybook in Super Mario Galaxy 2. The trailer also gives another look at the upcoming Super Mario Galaxy amiibo figures.

#SuperMarioGalaxy #Gaming #IGN
title: Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 - Official Overview Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Jump Space reviewed in Early Access by Will Borgor on PC, also available on Xbox.

After completing Jump Space’s first early access chapter, trying out both of its ships, and spending around 15 hours traveling the stars, I quite like what’s here – even if, like your starting ship, it’s still under construction. It’s best enjoyed with a group because co-op games almost always are, but also because there are plenty of relatively quiet moments where it’s basically a chill chat room in space. There are some parts of this ship that need a little TLC, but I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t nearly always having fun playing it. Even when things seem all but lost and everything’s on fire, you can still pull it out if you and your crew work together, play smart, and get a little lucky. Even though there’s still work to do to get Jump Space shipshape, particularly when it comes to adding more variety to its mission objectives, it’s already proven its concept is a winner.
title: Jump Space Early Access Review

author: IGN
description:
Tank Havoc is a fast-paced team-based action game with explosive tank combat and strategic elements. Battle across multiple modes, customize your tank, build a unique skill loadout, and adapt your tactics on the fly. Team up, flank hard, and unleash havoc in every match across dynamic arenas.
Head over to Steam and add Tank Havoc to your Wishlist.
title: Tank Havoc - Official Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Get a closer look at Town to City in this early access launch trailer for the cozy and creative citybuilder from the team behind Station to Station. The Town to City trailer showcases starting up your town, citizen management, growth and expansion, and more gameplay features. Town to City is available now in Early Access on PC via Steam.

Break free of the grid in Town to City: a cozy city builder that invites you to create a beautiful and bustling community. Freely place houses, shops, and amenities and natural elements to delight your residents and encourage new families to move in. As your population grows, so can your ambitions: create multiple towns that can grow alone or thrive together, helping the whole region develop and prosper.

In the campaign or sandbox mode, you're free to build at your own pace, placing each flower bed with pixel precision or prioritising growing your economy and developing your town into a thriving city.
title: Town to City - Official Early Access Launch Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Teaser Trailer for Allen Iv3rson, a three-part docuseries about the inspiring journey of former NBA superstar Allen Iverson from Shaquille O’Neal’s Jersey Legends (a division of Authentic Studios) and Stephen Curry and Erick Peyton’s Unanimous Media. Witness a one-of-a-kind look at the story of Allen Iverson, streaming October 23 exclusively on Amazon Prime Video.

Allen Iv3rson  is a three-part docuseries about the captivating life of basketball legend and global sensation Allen Iverson, whose authentic voice and unapologetic expression of style paved the way for future generations and revolutionized the culture of the NBA. From his origins in Hampton, VA, to his ascent as one of the most tenacious and exhilarating basketball players of all time, Iverson fearlessly embraced his individuality both on and off the court.

Allen Iv3rson will stream on October 23 exclusively on Amazon Prime Video.
title: Allen Iv3rson - Official Teaser Trailer (2025) Documentary

author: IGN
description: The return of Battlefield 3's Operation Firestorm map for Battlefield 6 is most welcome – and mostly fantastic. We also played (and loved) the huge new Mirak Valley map. Previewed by Travis Northup
title: Battlefield 6: All-Out Warfare (and One Iconic Map) Returns – and it Rocks

author: IGN
description:
Damage isn't only about physical DPS in Borderlands 4; you also have a whole elemental system to think about. There are five types of elemental damage, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Knowing your elemental damage types and how they work is crucial to success and is a huge part of combat. Let’s go over everything you need to know about the elemental chart, so you know how to combat each and every enemy type in Borderlands 4.

Timecodes:
0:00 - Intro
0:27 - How Elemental Damage Works
1:55 - Elemental Skills Chart
2:03 - How Elemental Weaknesses Work
3:10 - Elemental Weaknesses Chart
3:16 - Vex's Special Status Effect - Bleed
4:02 - Outro

#IGN #Gaming #Borderlands4
title: Borderlands 4 - Elemental Damage and Weaknesses Explained
